title-part.text: TRAFFIC CONTROL SYSTEMS

reference.text: guiding railway traffic, ensuring the safety of railway traffic B61L; arrangement of road signs or traffic signals E01F9/00; radar or analogous systems, sonar systems, lidar systems specially adapted for traffic control G01S13/91, G01S15/88, G01S17/88;

CPC-specific-text.text: radar or analogous systems, sonar systems, lidar systems specially adapted for anti-collision purposes G01S13/93, G01S15/93, G01S17/93

title-part.text: Traffic control systems for road vehicles

reference.text: arrangement of road signs or traffic signals E01F9/00;
automatic vehicle control B62D

note.note-paragraph: Groups G08G1/18 - G08G1/20 do not correspond to former or current IPC groups. Concordance CPC : IPC for these groups is as follows: - G08G1/20 : G08G1/123 - G08G1/22 : G08G1/16

title-part.text: including pedestrian guidance indicator
Detecting movement of traffic to be counted or controlled

reference.text: G08G1/07 to G08G1/14 take precedence

from the vehicle, e.g. floating car data [FCD]
from roadside infrastructure, e.g. beacons
from other sources than vehicle or roadside beacons, e.g. mobile networks
Traffic data processing
for creating historical data or processing based on historical data
for classifying traffic situation
for specific applications
for traffic information dissemination
for active traffic flow control

identifying vehicles

with provision for compensation of environmental or other condition, e.g. snow, vehicle stopped at detector
with provision for determining speed or overspeed

title-part.text: photographing overspeeding vehicles
with provision for distinguishing direction of travel
by counting the vehicles in a section of the road or in a parking area, i.e. comparing incoming count with outgoing count
Controlling traffic signals

title-part.text: according to detected number or speed of vehicles
Plural intersections under common control
Controlling the time between beginning of the same phase of a cycle at adjacent intersections
Controlling the allocation of time between phases of a cycle
using a free-running cyclic timer
Override of traffic control, e.g. by signal transmitted by an emergency vehicle
Arrangements for giving variable traffic instructions

transportable
provided with indicators in which a mark progresses showing the time elapsed, e.g. of green phase
having an indicator mounted inside the vehicle, e.g. giving voice messages

reference.text: G08G1/0967 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: where the origin of the information is within the own vehicle, e.g. a local storage device, digital map

title-part.text: responding to signals from another vehicle, e.g. emergency vehicle
Systems involving transmission of highway information, e.g. weather, speed limits

reference.text: transmission of navigation instructions to the vehicle G08G1/0968

CPC-specific-text.text: where the received information might be used to generate an automatic action on the vehicle control
where the received information does not generate an automatic action on the vehicle control
where the received information generates an automatic action on the vehicle control
where a selection of the information might take place
where the source of the transmitted information selects which information to transmit to each vehicle
where a selection from the received information takes place in the vehicle
where no selection takes place on the transmitted or the received information
where the system is characterised by the origin of the information transmission
where the origin of the information is a central station
where the origin of the information is a roadside individual element
where the origin of the information is another vehicle

title-part.text: Systems involving transmission of navigation instructions to the vehicle

reference.text: navigation or navigational instruments specially adapted for navigation in a road network G01C21/26

CPC-specific-text.text: where the transmitted instructions are used to compute a route
where the route is computed offboard
where the complete route is transmitted to the vehicle at once
where the segments of the route are transmitted to the vehicle at different locations and times
where the route is computed onboard
where different aspects are considered when computing the route
where the user preferences are taken into account or the user selects one route out of a plurality
where the complete route is dynamically recomputed based on new data
where the complete route is computed only once and not updated
where the output is provided in a suitable form to the driver

reference.text: details on I/O arrangements for onboard navigation computers G01C21/36

CPC-specific-text.text: where the immediate route instructions are output to the driver, e.g. arrow signs for next turn
where the complete route is shown to the driver
where instructions are given per voice
where the input to the navigation device is provided by a suitable I/O arrangement

reference.text: details of I/O arrangements for onboard navigation computers G01C21/36; I/O arrangements for general purpose computers G06F3/00

CPC-specific-text.text: where input information is obtained using a mobile device, e.g. a mobile phone, a PDA
where input information is obtained using learning systems, e.g. history databases

where input is assisted by the navigation device, i.e. the user does not type the complete name of the destination, e.g. using zip codes, telephone numbers, progressively selecting from initial letters

title-part.text: having a display in the form of a map
Supervising of traffic control systems, e.g. by giving an alarm if two crossing streets have green light simultaneously
indicating the position of vehicles, e.g. scheduled vehicles;

within the vehicle;

title-part.text: the indicator being in the form of a map
Indicating individual free spaces in parking areas

CPC-specific-text.text: with means giving the indication of available parking spaces
external to the vehicles
inside the vehicles
on portable or mobile units, e.g. personal digital assistant [PDA]
where the indication depends on the parking areas
where the parking area is a limited parking space, e.g. parking garage, restricted space
where the parking area is within an open public zone, e.g. city centre
Management of a network of parking areas
coupled to means for restricting the access to the parking space, e.g. authorization, access barriers, indicative lights

title-part.text: Anti-collision systems

reference.text: road vehicle drive control systems for predicting or avoiding probable or impending collision otherwise than by control of a particular sub-unit B60W30/08

CPC-specific-text.text: Decentralised systems, e.g. inter-vehicle communication
event-triggered
involving continuous checking
Centralised systems, e.g. external to vehicles
for passive traffic, e.g. including static obstacles, trees
for active traffic, e.g. moving vehicles, pedestrians, bikes
Driving aids for lane monitoring, lane changing, e.g. blind spot detection
Driving aids for parking, e.g. acoustic or visual feedback on parking space
Monitoring the location of vehicles belonging to a group, e.g. fleet of vehicles, countable or determined number of vehicles
Dispatching vehicles on the basis of a location, e.g. taxi dispatching
Indicating the location of the monitored vehicles as destination, e.g. accidents, stolen, rental
with respect to certain areas, e.g. forbidden or allowed areas with possible alerting when inside or outside boundaries
Platooning, i.e. convoy of communicating vehicles

title-part.text: Traffic control systems for marine craft

reference.text: marking of navigational route B63B22/16, B63B51/00

title-part.text: Anti-collision systems
Traffic control systems for aircraft,

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. air-traffic control [ATC

note.note-paragraph: 1. This groups covers arrangements, located in the aircraft or on the ground, for controlling aircraft within a traffic environment.

2. This group does not cover arrangements for control of position, course, altitude or attitude of aircraft not specific to a traffic environment, e.g. automatic pilots, which are covered by group G05D1/00.
3. In this group the following term is used with the meaning indicated: - "traffic" includes traffic on the ground and in the air.

4. Attention is drawn to the following places which might be interesting for search: - mechanical aspects of equipment for fitting in or to aircraft B64D - combined instruments indicating more than one navigational value G01C23/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Transmission of traffic-related information to or from an aircraft

reference.text: airborne radio transmission systems in general H04B7/185; airborne wireless networks H04W84/06

CPC-specific-text.text: with other aircraft
with a ground station
Arrangements for implementing traffic-related aircraft activities, e.g. arrangements for generating, displaying, acquiring or managing traffic information

reference.text: head-up displays G02B27/01; ground or aircraft-carrier-deck-installations B64F

CPC-specific-text.text: located in the aircraft
located on the ground
Flight plan management
Assembly of a flight plan
Modification of a flight plan
Traffic management of multiple aircrafts from the ground

reference.text: G08G5/003 takes precedence; data processing specially designed for resource management, e.g. scheduling or allocating time, human or machine resources G06Q10/00C
